name: BEST WESTERN Seven Seas

reviews.text: Good- Good location for the Zoo, Sea World, Seaport Village, and Balboa Park, especially since the hotel provides a free shuttle to those places. Decent sized room and clean with a king bed. Pretty palm trees all around. Cheap.
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.text: Bad- They don't tell you that you need to have your name on the list for the morning shuttle run to the zoo and Sea World so if they are full, you are out of luck. Food is not good. Located near highway. The shuttle comes to get you eight hours after they drop you off to the zoo or Sea World so if you don't want to stay that long, you will have to take a taxi back.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: Summary- If you are spending your days at the attractions that they shuttle to, and don't want to drive yourself, then the price can't be beat. It's sort of like a Motel 6.
reviews.title: aahhh it was OK
Horrible Hotel
reviews.text: I would like to say that this hotel is a very nice place to stay---and it is especially nice if your traveling with the kids!! The food was decent and the surroundings were beautiful. I missed my shuttle to the bus station to go to LA and the hotel paid for a cab to the bus station for me!! I highly recommend this hotel to stay at with the family. Tashi from Philadelphia

Stayed 2 days, Checked in Monday the NON SMOKING room we we're given stank, the front desk was almost no help stating they would send up housekeeping to "spray" some air freshener... it stank of smoke and mildew, I asked for a refund and was greeted with an "you'll have to take that up with Hotel, COM attitude. Finally got in touch with the night desk manager Steve and insisted he come smell the room.
reviews.title: Very convenient and good value

reviews.text: The room was clean and up to "Best Western" standards. It's located on Hotel Circle and this makes it easy to get to all of San Diego's sites and attractions. There is plenty of casual dining nearby as well as grocery/drug stores. The on site restaurant is pretty good; we ate breakfast there 3 times and always had a good meal. This is an older property, but the grounds are immaculantly kept up and the landscaping is very lush. It kind of reminded my of a garden in Hawaii. There were two hot tubs... one stand alone and one by the pool. Since the little ones were by the pool, the adults had a hot tub all to themselves... much appreciated after a day at Sea World!
reviews.title: Convenient Location and a Nice Hotel
Nice
reviews.text: Very friendly people and a good restaurant. The room is just what you expect from a best western.
We stayed here for 4 nights in September. This was the next place we stayed at after Disney hotel...... the size of the room came as a bit of a shock! The smallest one so far!!
reviews.title: Great little Motel

likes.liked: — The location, so near Seaworld and Fashion Mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very clean and tidy. A little bit of a squash as we needed to get our toddlers cot into the room too. He kind of had to be half pushed into the cupboard to allow us to get into the bathroom!!!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - shame about the room size

reviews.text: The location of the motel was superb. Our room was on the ground floor away from the Freeway. Were heard no noise from other guests or traffic.
reviews.title: This hotel does not care about its guests

reviews.text: We stayed at the Best Western Seven Seas for 3 days on our way to a mexican cruise. We found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable. The shuttle service that was provided was a real bonus. They picked us up from the airport, took us to and picked us up from Sea World, and also took us to the cruise ship terminal. The shuttle drivers Norman and Maui were very friendly. The staff in the restaurant were really a lot of fun and helpful as were the front desk staff. The grounds we also very well kept and clean. We had a very nice stay!
reviews.title: very nice stay
Good value Best Western, but tough beds
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 days at the end of Feb 2007. The local on Hotel Circle is great – very convenient to Mission Bay and Mission, Ocean, and Pacific Beaches, to Old Town, to Balboa Park, and to downtown. The heated pool and 2 hottubs were nice. There is a little workout room (not mentioned by Best Western listing, it seems), with extra towels for the pool. Plenty of vending machines. Rooms at the east side of each of the 3 buildings are near the 163 freeway; you can hear traffic noise unless you run the heater/AC. Rooms near the jungle walkway through the property (i.e., lots of plants, very nice) had more “tropical” location; ours was far from this and seemed more like a standard motel room. The room was clean. The TV had many cable channels though some hotels have more (e.g., no A&E, HGTV, or History) and no movie channels, only pay Movies on Demand. The major problem was that the beds were very firm and somewhat sagging toward the middle. Nice place, but uncomfortable sleeping. There was a single computer in the lobby for guest use for the internet; don’t know whether there was wireless.

The Seven Seas is not fantastic but a great value. I've stayed there 3 times and has always been adequate. Grounds are nice and it is a close walk under the freeway to the Town and Country Hotel and Convention Center, where you will pay nearly double for a similar room. When I was a student going to a conference it was a good way to save money. Now that someone else pays the bills I still stay at the Seven Seas
reviews.title: Close to Town and Country

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our honeymoon in San Diego and choose Best Western Seven Seas. Staff was very friendly and made us feel like family during our week getaway. Hotel has a nice shuttle service if you can figure out when it runs... very close to Sea World which made for a good time as well. Will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Best Western Seven Seas while on a stopover in San Diego on our way to Cabo San Lucas. While it's not a very fancy hotel, it did provide free airport shuttle service (the airport wasn't far at all), and we had just a short stroll to the trolley (which we took to see a Chargers football game), as well as the Fashion Valley Mall, which has some amazing shopping.
reviews.title: Perfect location

likes.liked: — Close to transportation, airport, and great shopping
likes.disliked: — Buildings are spread out, if your room is on second floor there are no elevators

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in mid-June and had a very good stay. The rooms, although not large, were certainly adequate for two people (one King bed) and the bed was very comfortable. The room was also very clean and all of the amenities worked well. One thing that was strange was that there appeared to be only one plug in for fridge, hairdryer and any other electric tolietries you may have (toothbrush, shaver), so only one could be used at a time. But really this was a minor inconvenience.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.text: The grounds were very well kept, as was the pool. As we were there during school holidays the pool was very busy all of the time, so it was nice to have a hot tub in a separate location, which was much quieter. Although our room was located closest to the road, we did not notice any road noise from inside the room. All of our interactions with the staff were very positive and responses to our requests were very quick.
reviews.title: nice property

reviews.text: Although initially unsure of the location on Hotel Circle, as I prefer to be able to be in the center of a city, I was happy with it. Access to all the attractions was very easy and a useful directions sheet was provided by the front desk to make this even simpler.
reviews.title: a good room for the price

description: Motor Hotel in landscaped grounds on I-8, 4 miles from Sea World or San Diego Zoo.
